Class twitterAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • twitterAuth
  • public class twitterAuth
extends java.lang.Object
    This simple class authorizes the Twitter api using tokens and secrets provided.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int authWorks

      twitterAuth​(java.lang.String cAPI, java.lang.String apiSec, java.lang.String aTok, java.lang.String tokSec)
      Constructor for the twitterAuth class, needs system variables for consumer api, api secret, account token, and token secret to function.

    • Field Detail

      • authWorks

        public int authWorks

    • Constructor Detail

      • twitterAuth

        public twitterAuth​(java.lang.String cAPI,
                   java.lang.String apiSec,
                   java.lang.String aTok,
                   java.lang.String tokSec)
        Constructor for the twitterAuth class, needs system variables for consumer api, api secret, account token, and token secret to function.
        Parameters:
        cAPI - The system variable for the consumer API for Twitter.
        apiSec - The system variable for the API secret from the Twitter devleoper portal.
        aTok - The system variable for the Account Token from Twitter.
        tokSec - The systen variable for the token secret from Twitter.

    • Method Detail

      • authorize

        public twitter4j.Twitter authorize()
        Returns a twitter instance with credentials.
        Returns:
        Twitter object from the twitter4j library, the object has the credentials passed into it and lets us use the session.

      • invalidSysVar

        public java.lang.String invalidSysVar()
        Returns the invalid System Varaibles.
        Returns:
        A comma seperated list of invalid system variables if there are any, "none" if all are valid.

      • sysVarIsValid

        public boolean sysVarIsValid()
        Lets user know if Twitter authentication was successful.
        Returns:
        True if all system variables are valid, false if at least one is not.
